results.title: The Efficacy of Beta-Blockers in Patients With Long QT Syndrome 1-3 According to Individuals' Gender, Age, and QTc Intervals: A Network Meta-analysis
results.text_hl: Clinical evidence from numerous previous studies suggested that beta blockers (BBs), including @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@, @CHEMICAL_Propranolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D011433 @@@propranolol@@@, @CHEMICAL_Metoprolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008790 @@@metoprolol@@@, and @CHEMICAL_Nadolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D009248 @@@nadolol@@@, exhibit different efficacies for reducing the risk of cardiac events (CEs), such as @DISEASE_Syncope @DISEASE_MESH:D013575 @@@syncope@@@, @<m>DISEASE_Heart_Arrest</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006323 @@@arrest cardiac arrest@@@ (@<m>DISEASE_Heart_Arrest</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006323 @@@ACA@@@), and @DISEASE_Death_Sudden_Cardiac @DISEASE_MESH:D016757 @@@SCD@@@, in @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with @DISEASE_Post_Acute_COVID_19_Syndrome @DISEASE_MESH:D000094024 @@@LQTS@@@.

citations.NLM: Han L, Liu F, Li Q, Qing T, Zhai Z, Xia Z, Li J. The Efficacy of Beta-Blockers in Patients With Long QT Syndrome 1-3 According to Individuals' Gender, Age, and QTc Intervals: A Network Meta-analysis Front Pharmacol. 2020;11():579525. PMID: 33381033
citations.BibTeX: @article{33381033, title={The Efficacy of Beta-Blockers in Patients With Long QT Syndrome 1-3 According to Individuals' Gender, Age, and QTc Intervals: A Network Meta-analysis}, author={Han L and Liu F and Li Q and Qing T and Zhai Z and Xia Z and Li J}, journal={Front Pharmacol}, volume={11}, pages={579525}}

results.title: Treatment for beta-blocker poisoning: a systematic review.
results.text_hl: @CHEMICAL_Lidocaine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008012 @@@Lignocaine@@@: There were four case reports showing variable response to @CHEMICAL_Lidocaine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008012 @@@lignocaine@@@ in @DISEASE_Arrhythmias_Cardiac @DISEASE_MESH:D001145 @@@arrhythmias@@@ secondary to beta-blocker @DISEASE_Drug_Related_Side_Effects_and_Adverse_Reactions @DISEASE_MESH:D064420 @@@toxicity@@@.Other treatments: @CHEMICAL_Fructosediphosphates @CHEMICAL_MESH:D005635 @@@Fructose diphosphate@@@, @CHEMICAL_Simendan @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000077464 @@@levosimendan@@@ and @CHEMICAL_Amrinone @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000676 @@@amrinone@@@ did not provide a mortality or significant haemodynamic benefit in three animal studies and nine case reports. .Veno-arterial extracorporeal membrane oxygenation: Veno-arterial extracorporeal membrane oxygenation was associated with improved survival in @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with severe @DISEASE_Shock_Cardiogenic @DISEASE_MESH:D012770 @@@cardiogenic shock@@@ or @<m>DISEASE_Heart_Arrest</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006323 @@@cardiac arrest@@@ in an observational study and four cases series.Dialysis: The evidence of four case reports suggest haemodialysis may assist in the management of massive @DISEASE_Drug_Overdose @DISEASE_MESH:D062787 @@@overdose@@@ of specific water-soluble beta-blockers (e.g., @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@) by improving elimination; however, a survival or haemodynamic benefit was not established.Pacing: One case series and a single case report showed the utility of temporary overdrive cardiac pacing to prevent @DISEASE_Arrhythmias_Cardiac @DISEASE_MESH:D001145 @@@arrhythmias@@@ in @CHEMICAL_Sotalol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D013015 @@@sotalol@@@ @DISEASE_Drug_Related_Side_Effects_and_Adverse_Reactions @DISEASE_MESH:D064420 @@@toxicity@@@.Conclusions: @CHEMICAL_Catecholamines @CHEMICAL_MESH:D002395 @@@Catecholamines@@@, vasopressors, high-dose @GENE_INS @GENE_3630 @@@insulin@@@ euglycaemic therapy and veno-arterial extracorporeal membrane oxygenation were associated with reduced mortality.

citations.NLM: Rotella JA, Greene SL, Koutsogiannis Z, Graudins A, Hung Leang Y, Kuan K, Baxter H, Bourke E, Wong A. Treatment for beta-blocker poisoning: a systematic review. Clin Toxicol (Phila). 2020 Oct;58(10):943-983. PMID: 32310006
citations.BibTeX: @article{32310006, title={Treatment for beta-blocker poisoning: a systematic review.}, author={Rotella JA and Greene SL and Koutsogiannis Z and Graudins A and Hung Leang Y and Kuan K and Baxter H and Bourke E and Wong A}, journal={Clin Toxicol (Phila)}, volume={58}, number={10}, pages={943-983}}

results.title: A Case of Life-threatening Amlodipine and Atenolol Overdose
results.text_hl: A Case of Life-threatening @CHEMICAL_Amlodipine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@Amlodipine@@@ and @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@Atenolol@@@ Overdose

results.title: Combination pharmacotherapy in the treatment of experimental cardiac arrest.
results.text_hl: CONCLUSIONS: The administration of a drug combination of @CHEMICAL_Epinephrine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D004837 @@@epinephrine@@@ + @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ + @CHEMICAL_Simendan @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000077464 @@@levosimendan@@@, when given during CPR, in a @SPECIES_9823 @@@pig@@@ model of @<m>DISEASE_Heart_Arrest</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006323 @@@cardiac arrest@@@, results in improved 48-hour survival and improves postresuscitation cardiac function.

citations.NLM: Xanthos T, Bassiakou E, Koudouna E, Rokas G, Goulas S, Dontas I, Kouskouni E, Perrea D, Papadimitriou L. Combination pharmacotherapy in the treatment of experimental cardiac arrest. Am J Emerg Med. 2009 Jul;27(6):651-9. PMID: 19751621
citations.BibTeX: @article{19751621, title={Combination pharmacotherapy in the treatment of experimental cardiac arrest.}, author={Xanthos T and Bassiakou E and Koudouna E and Rokas G and Goulas S and Dontas I and Kouskouni E and Perrea D and Papadimitriou L}, journal={Am J Emerg Med}, volume={27}, number={6}, pages={651-9}}

results.title: Normothermic ischemic cardiac arrest in the isolated working rabbit heart: effects of dl-nebivolol and atenolol.
results.text_hl: Normothermic @<m>DISEASE_Heart_Arrest</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006323 @@@ischemic cardiac arrest@@@ in the isolated working @SPECIES_9986 @@@rabbit@@@ heart: effects of dl-nebivolol and @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@.

results.title: Severe atenolol and diltiazem overdose.
results.text_hl: @<m>DISEASE_Heart_Arrest</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006323 @@@Cardiac arrest@@@ ensued which was responsive to cardiopulmonary resuscitation.

results.title: Treatment of atenolol overdose in a patient with renal failure using serial hemodialysis and hemoperfusion and associated echocardiographic findings.
results.text_hl: A 28-y-old male with @DISEASE_Kidney_Failure_Chronic @DISEASE_MESH:D007676 @@@end stage renal failure@@@ (@DISEASE_Kidney_Failure_Chronic @DISEASE_MESH:D007676 @@@ESRF@@@) received an @DISEASE_Drug_Overdose @DISEASE_MESH:D062787 @@@overdose@@@ of @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@. Subsequent @<m>DISEASE_Heart_Arrest</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006323 @@@cardiac arrest@@@ and prolonged @DISEASE_Shock_Cardiogenic @DISEASE_MESH:D012770 @@@cardiogenic shock@@@ required aggressive pharmacologic support, intraaortic balloon pump insertion, and mechanical ventilation.

citations.NLM: Salhanick SD, Wax PM. Treatment of atenolol overdose in a patient with renal failure using serial hemodialysis and hemoperfusion and associated echocardiographic findings. Vet Hum Toxicol. 2000 Aug;42(4):224-5. PMID: 10928688
citations.BibTeX: @article{10928688, title={Treatment of atenolol overdose in a patient with renal failure using serial hemodialysis and hemoperfusion and associated echocardiographic findings.}, author={Salhanick SD and Wax PM}, journal={Vet Hum Toxicol}, volume={42}, number={4}, pages={224-5}}

results.title: Early intravenous atenolol treatment in suspected acute myocardial infarction. Preliminary report of a randomised trial.
results.text_hl: In hospital, fewer @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ died (4 vs 9), had non-fatal @<m>DISEASE_Heart_Arrest</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006323 @@@cardiac arrests@@@ (2 vs 6), or required therapy for @DISEASE_Heart_Failure @DISEASE_MESH:D006333 @@@heart-failure@@@ (36 vs 47).

citations.NLM: Yusuf S, Ramsdale D, Peto R, Furse L, Bennett D, Bray C, Sleight P. Early intravenous atenolol treatment in suspected acute myocardial infarction. Preliminary report of a randomised trial. Lancet. 1980 Aug 9;2(8189):273-6. PMID: 6105436
citations.BibTeX: @article{6105436, title={Early intravenous atenolol treatment in suspected acute myocardial infarction. Preliminary report of a randomised trial.}, author={Yusuf S and Ramsdale D and Peto R and Furse L and Bennett D and Bray C and Sleight P}, journal={Lancet}, volume={2}, number={8189}, pages={273-6}}

results.title: Mechanisms for the early mortality reduction produced by beta-blockade started early in acute myocardial infarction: ISIS-1. ISIS-1 (First International Study of Infarct Survival) Collaborative Group.
results.text_hl: There was a slightly higher incidence of fatal @DISEASE_Ventricular_Fibrillation @DISEASE_MESH:D014693 @@@ventricular fibrillation@@@ and @DISEASE_Aortic_Dissection @DISEASE_MESH:D000784 @@@aortic dissection@@@ in the control group, and of @DISEASE_Bradycardia @DISEASE_MESH:D001919 @@@bradycardia@@@/@<m>DISEASE_Heart_Arrest</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006323 @@@asystole@@@ in the @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ group.

citations.NLM: Mechanisms for the early mortality reduction produced by beta-blockade started early in acute myocardial infarction: ISIS-1. ISIS-1 (First International Study of Infarct Survival) Collaborative Group. Lancet. 1988 Apr 23;1(8591):921-3. PMID: 2895838

results.title: Randomised trial of intravenous atenolol among 16 027 cases of suspected acute myocardial infarction: ISIS-1. First International Study of Infarct Survival Collaborative Group.
results.text_hl: Slightly fewer non-fatal @<m>DISEASE_Heart_Arrest</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006323 @@@cardiac arrests@@@ (189 vs 198) and reinfarctions (148 vs 161) were recorded in the @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ group, neither difference being significant.

citations.NLM: Randomised trial of intravenous atenolol among 16 027 cases of suspected acute myocardial infarction: ISIS-1. First International Study of Infarct Survival Collaborative Group. Lancet. 1986 Jul 12;2(8498):57-66. PMID: 2873379
